titleStmt.title: C. F. Beyland to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG2156

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
JOHN P. JACKSON, President.
C. W. MOULTON, Vice President
C. F. BEYLAND, Secretary.

Office of the United Life, Fire and Marine Insurance Co.,
OF KENTUCKY
Scott Street, between Third and Fourth Streets.
Covington, Ky, August 11th 1865

Hon. E. L. Vanwinkle
Secretary of State
Frankfort Ky.
Sir,
Having a good many acknowledgements to obtain in my capacity as an officer of this company, I would respectfully request to be appointed Notary Public for Kenton County.

I am, Sir, your obedt servant
C. F. Beyland
Mr. Beyland is an excellent business man and gentleman. I hope you will commission him

Notary Public
C. F. Beyland
apptd
12 Aug 1865
